messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The Capitol (government of Panem) starts them to punish the districts for a past rebellion. Every year, one boy and one girl, from 12 to 18 years old, are chosen from each district in a random draw. They must fight in a competition, and only one person will live. People call the chosen teenagers "tributes" (players in the Hunger Games). Everyone in the country must watch the games on TV.
Feedback received: Grade 6/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: Fidelity breaches and some lexis above B1. 1) Added entity and semantic shift: "The Capitol (government of Panem) starts them to punish the districts for a past rebellion." "Panem" is not in the Original. You also replace "uses to remind" with "starts them to punish," removing the key idea of "remind" and adding "past," which is not stated. 2) Lexis level: "rebellion" (in place of Original "rebelling") and the phrase "random draw" are likely above B1 and not defined as Keywords. The Original uses the simpler, provided B1 word "lottery." 3) Sentence length: "Every year, one boy and one girl, from 12 to 18 years old, are chosen from each district in a random draw." is 22 words, exceeding the ≈15-word target. 4) Possible fidelity softening: "They must fight in a competition" weakens Original "battle" (B1 and more precise about violence). 5) Keyword handling: "Capitol" and "tributes" are briefly defined; that part is acceptable. Grammar and connectors are mostly B1, but the above issues prevent a pass.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Every year, the Hunger Games occur. The Capitol (capital city) uses the games to remind districts they are punished for rebelling. Each district chooses one boy and one girl by lottery. They compete in a battle where only one person survives. The chosen teenagers are called tributes (players). The nation must watch the games on television.
Feedback received: Grade 6/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: Meaning shift and additions break fidelity. 1) Changed intent: 'starts them to punish the districts for a past rebellion' replaces 'uses to remind the districts that they are being punished for rebelling.' You removed 'remind' and made it direct punishment. 2) Added entity: '(government of Panem)' introduces 'Panem', which is not in the Original. 3) Unnecessary lexis change: 'in a random draw' replaces 'by lottery' (B1 in the Original) and is less common, raising level without need. 4) One sentence is too long and stacked: 'Every year, one boy and one girl, from 12 to 18 years old, are chosen from each district in a random draw.' (~22 words; exceeds the ~15-word target). Positives: Keywords 'Capitol' and 'tributes' are briefly defined; grammar and connectors are mostly B1; other facts (one boy and one girl, ages, one survivor, forced viewing) are preserved.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Every year, the Hunger Games occur. The Capitol (capital city) uses the games to remind the districts that they are being punished for rebelling. Each district chooses one boy and one girl aged 12 to 18 by lottery. They compete in a battle where only one person survives. The chosen teenagers are called tributes (players). The nation must watch the games on television.
Feedback received: Grade 6/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: Fidelity breach: "The Capitol (government of Panem) starts them to punish the districts for a past rebellion." adds "Panem" (not in Original) and changes purpose from "remind ... being punished" to "punish"; also adds "past rebellion." Modality shift: "only one person will live" alters "can survive." Length/Form: "Every year, one boy and one girl, from 12 to 18 years old, are chosen from each district in a random draw." is 22 words and overlong for B1. Vocabulary: mostly B1; "random draw" may be less common than the Original’s B1 "lottery." Keywords: defined, but the "Capitol" definition introduces new entity (Panem), violating no-additions rule. Cohesion/connectors are simple and fine.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: The Hunger Games are an annual event. The Capitol (capital city) uses the games. It reminds the districts they are punished for rebelling. Each district chooses one boy and one girl, aged 12 to 18, by lottery. They compete in a battle where only one person can survive. The chosen teenagers are called tributes (players). The whole nation must watch the games on television.
Feedback received: Grade 6/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL. Fidelity breach: 'The Capitol (government of Panem) starts them to punish the districts for a past rebellion.' adds 'government of Panem' (not in Original) and shifts meaning from 'uses to remind they are being punished' to 'to punish' (semantic change). Form issue: 'Every year, one boy and one girl, from 12 to 18 years old, are chosen from each district in a random draw.' is about 22 words, exceeding the B1 target and stacking inserts. Keywords: 'tributes' is briefly defined ('players in the Hunger Games'), good; 'Capitol' is defined but with extra information ('Panem'), which is an addition. Lexis and grammar elsewhere are mostly B1, and other facts (ages, selection, one survivor, everyone must watch) are preserved.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: The Hunger Games are an annual event. The Capitol (capital city) uses it to show the districts they are punished for rebelling. Each district chooses one boy and one girl by lottery. They are aged 12 to 18. They fight in a battle where only one person survives. The chosen teenagers are called tributes (players in the Hunger Games). The whole nation must watch the games on television.

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL. 'The Capitol (government of Panem) starts them to punish the districts for a past rebellion.' Changes the Original’s purpose ('uses to remind ... they are being punished for rebelling') to direct punishment. Also adds 'Panem,' a new entity not in the Original. Sentence too long: 'Every year, one boy and one girl, from 12 to 18 years old, are chosen from each district in a random draw.' ≈22 words (target ≈15). Lexis issue: 'random draw' skews above B1; 'lottery' is the simpler B1 candidate. Keywords were defined ('Capitol', 'tributes'), but the fidelity error is significant.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: The Hunger Games are an annual event. The Capitol (capital city) uses them to remind the districts that they are punished for rebelling. Each district chooses one boy and one girl by lottery. They are aged 12 to 18. They fight in a battle where one person survives. The chosen teenagers are called tributes (players). The whole nation must watch the event on television.
Feedback received: Grade 5/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: Fidelity breach: 'The Capitol (government of Panem) starts them to punish the districts for a past rebellion.' changes 'uses to remind ... that they are being punished' to direct punishment, and adds 'Panem' (not in Original). Added named entity violates no-additions rule. Keyword handling: 'Capitol' is defined, but definition introduces new info ('of Panem'); 'tributes' is defined as 'players in the Hunger Games' (acceptable). Sentence length: 'Every year, one boy and one girl, from 12 to 18 years old, are chosen from each district in a random draw.' is ~22 words, too long for B1 and contains stacked commas. Vocabulary replacement: 'random draw' replaces 'lottery' (B1) with a less basic phrase; unnecessary raise in complexity. Overall grammar is mostly B1 and cohesion is simple, but the factual shift and addition force a fail.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: The Hunger Games are an annual event. The Capitol (capital city) uses the event to show the districts. The districts are punished for rebelling. Each district chooses one boy and one girl by lottery. They are 12 to 18 years old. They fight in a battle. Only one person survives. The chosen teenagers are called tributes (players). The whole nation must watch the event on television.
Feedback received: Grade 7/10 - PASS

metadata.feedback_text: Mostly B1: clear sentences, simple grammar, keywords defined. Keyword handling: "Capitol (government of Panem)" and "tributes" are briefly defined at first mention. However, fidelity slips: "starts them to punish the districts for a past rebellion" changes "uses to remind the districts that they are being punished" (purpose shifts from reminder to punishment). Vocabulary: "random draw" is above B1 and not a keyword; original used the simpler, specific "lottery." "rebellion" may be above B1; original had "rebelling." Cohesion: basic connectors used well. Form: one sentence is too long for B1—"Every year, one boy and one girl, from 12 to 18 years old, are chosen from each district in a random draw." (≈22 words). Accuracy: numbers and roles are preserved. Minor addition: "Panem" is introduced; it is not in the Original.
